content:
Considerations for Broadcast SMS Messaging in Service Cloud

This article applies to Standard SMS channels.

Standard SMS channels are scheduled for retirement, and we're limiting the ability to create standard channels. To avoid service interruptions, upgrade your standard SMS channels to enhanced channels before February 14, 2026.

Broadcast Messaging is supported only in standard SMS channels.

Don't use a long number for broadcast messages, as carriers impose limits for bulk text messages from long numbers.
Messaging templates are required to send a message.
Broadcast messages can't be sent in SMS channels that use Omni-Channel flow routing.
Messaging User records are required for your recipients, even if you're sending a message from another object type.
You can use Broadcast Messaging for employees only if you've purchased Work.com.

It's possible to go over your SMS allotment. If you send more messages than you've paid for, our team will help you make another payment.
We don't search for duplicate recipients when sending broadcast messages.
Broadcast Messaging and Messaging can be used together.
Be mindful of the values you store about your recipients. Avoid collecting information that you donâ€™t need and any vulnerable information that could be used for discrimination.

Upgrading from Standard to Enhanced Messaging is recommended before February 14, 2026.
title: Broadcast SMS Messaging Considerations in Service Cloud
